title: How many number one hits did Carole King have? - Quora

response.answer_text: She had many number one hits for others and only one as a solo artist. “It’s Too Late”/ “I Feel The Earth Move HIT #1: June 19, 1971 “Will You Love Me Tomorrow” - The Shirelles HIT #1: January 30, 1961 “Take Good Care Of My Baby” - Bobby Vee HIT #1: September 18, 1961 “Go Away Little Girl” - Steve Lawrence HIT #1: January 12, 1963 “The Loco-Motion” - Little Eva HIT #1: August 25, 1962 But only one song gave her, her only number one hit as a single artist and that was "I Feel the Earth Move, it was the B side to “It's Too Late.”

I’d say about 1,000. When she wasn’t writing for herself, she was writing for others. Many of those girl groups of the early to mid 60s sang songs written by Carol, and her then husband, Gerry Goffin; Carol would later rearrange those songs and put them on her earlier albums. My own particular favourite is Up On the Roof. She remains one of my female icons from North America, the other’s being Joni Mitchel and Carly Simon. All amazing women. Saw Carol in concert, in Dublin, in 1983.
